author: sandrosandro

comments.content: It reminds me of a customized OLRound Gothic-Light, by Dennis Ortiz-Lopez. But, yeah, now that I look, I think Renko may be right!

i think it is too light for avantgarde extra light. hm...

maybe it is itc avantgarde extra light, with alternates and some custom glyphs?  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/itc-avant-garde-gothic/itc-avant-...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150109082550/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/itc-avant-garde-gothic/itc-avant-garde-extra-light/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/itc-avant-garde-gothic/itc-avant-garde-extra-light/")  
or it is something custom completely?

p.s i haven't noticed elsner flake's extra light. i think it is pretty close, like itc's version.

It is Avant Garde Extra Light Alternate and then someone played with it - joining some figures in ways that are related to the joined ones in the font but new and fun. I checked my ITC Typeface Collection book from 1980 and none are shown in the phototype era either.

i tryed elsner's extra light. it' s not the same.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150109082550im_/http:/typophile.com/files/hilaryrCOMPARISON_5097.jpg)
Given the basic shape and proportions seem to match, I'd wager it was modified by thinning it out a bit more and connecting the parts that were a bit more abnormal.
Have you tried outlining the text and then putting a stroke on it to shrink the line thickness?
jselig i tought of this also :) . just trying to find something that is ready to buy / download hehe :D
I measured EF Avant Garde and it appears to be just a tiny bit thicker than ITC version I have. Interesting...
i think that this weight was customly made :). hairline eh :D. btw it is easy to create this kind of weight in illustrator. i tryed :D
